ProfessionalSummary:
Entrepreneur-minded, results-driven designer with a broad set of skills applicable across different
sectors and roles. My background includes contributing to all aspects of traditional and digital
marketing and advertising for multi-million-dollar companies. I excel in creative support roles that
require brand creative development. My recent projects/contracts include design implementation of
established brand equities. Performs well in high-pressure, competitive environments. Dedicated to
producing creative win-win solutions and outcomes.

• ReBranding - Layout of consumer and business-to-business marketing materials
• Brochures, Catalogs, Direct Mail - Design and layout of printed multi-page materials
• Social Media - Created campaigns for Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn
• PowerPoint - Created Master templates. Updated large page count decks
• Promotions - Design, develop engaging consumer POP/POS campaigns
• Mechanical Art Production - Create, preflight press/digital artwork

A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
Every position in a resume should have a job title.
Every position in a resume should have an employer name.
Every degree in a resume should have a name or type associated with it, such as 'B.S.' or 'M.S.'.
High school (or lower) education should not be included on resumes that contain higher-level education.
